datafield.subfield: Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 107
Origin: As appears in colophon on p.123, transcription completed Dhū al-Qaʻadah 1150 [Feb-Mar 1738].
Accompanying materials: Cut out of a masjid inserted between pp.66-67.
Former shelfmark: British Museum, London "No. 73. Talim al-mutaallim."

Binding: Pasteboards (semi-limp) covered in laid paper with dark brown leather at spine, fore-edge flap and edges/turn-ins ; Type III binding (without flap) ; board linings in indigo laid paper ; sewn in cream thread, two stations, often broken, all quires quite loose ; in very poor condition with significant abrasion, lifting and losses of paper and leather, delamination of boards, cover detaching at spine, etc. ; repairs in wove paper ; housed in envelope.

Support: European laid paper of several types ; one type with 6-7 laid lines per cm. (vertical), chain lines spaced 30-33 mm. apart (horizontal), three crescent (tre lune) watermark (compare Heawood 869-870), thick and burnished though not very smooth ; another type much thinner and only lightly burnished, with 11 laid lines per cm. (vertical), chain lines spaced 20-23 mm. apart (horizontal), crown above band with "I P" above grapes watermark ; soiled, stained and dog-eared.
Decoration: Keywords and section headings rubricated ; occasional overlining in red.

Script: Naskh ; fine Turkish hand ; mainly sans serif, but occasional head serifs appear on lām of definite article ; strong horizontal character, adhering to baseline ; slight contrast in thickness between horizontal and vertical strokes ; many descenders flattened (mabsūṭah) ; many closed counters ; point of final nūn usually assimilated with bowl.
Layout: Written in 17 lines per page ; frame-ruled (impression of ruling board evident).
Collation: V (10), IV (18), 2 V(38), V-2 (46), V (56), III (62) ; chiefly quinions ; catchwords present ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals, supplied during digitization.
Colophon: "Scribal," triangular, reads: "وتمامه في شهر ذي القعدة الشريفة على يد اضعف العباد غفر الله له ولوالديه واحسن اليهما واليه وتاريخ السنة خمسين ومائة والف سنة ۱۱٥٠"

Explicit: "فاين تجد ذلك الكتاب فأجاب بقوله يجده من يطلبه هو كتاب مشهور ومعتبر بين العلماء فلا بد لطالب العلم من ان يجده ويتبرك بالاثار والخبار المذكورة فيه . الحمد لله على التمام والصلوة والسلام على محمد خير افضل الرسل الكرام ..."
Incipit: "الحمد لله الذي انعم علينا بانواع النعم ولطائف الاحسان ... وبعد فلما رأيت الكتاب المسمى بتعليم المتعلم ... اردت ان اشرحه شرحا ..."
M. Plessner-[J.P. Berkey]. "al- Zarnūdjī , Burhān al- Dīn." In EI2,
Fine copy of Ibn Ismāʻīl's commentary on al-Zarnūjī's treatise on proper behavior for successful study, manner of instruction, attitudes to the material, and the teacher-student relationship.
Acquired by purchase along with Abdul Hamid Collection (funds donated by Horace Rackham).

Bookplate of British Museum, London on interior of upper cover, "British Museum, London. No. 73. Talim al-mutaallim." ; circular seal impression with figure of goat/gazelle in purple ink as well as inscription "329" in Western numerals on 'title page' (p.1) ; on blue-tinted paper pasted on ’title page’ (p.1), a detailed waqf statement in the name of al-Sayyid ʻAbd Allāh Adīb (Abdullah Edip), known as Jannatʹzādah (Cennet-zade), qāḍī of Erzurum, accompanied by his seal, reads: "وقفت وقفا صحيحا شرعيا بشرط ان لا يخرج من بيت الكتب الذي بنيته في اتصال داري ان احتاجوا اشد الاحتياج بكفيل مرعى اورهن قوي وانا الفقير اليه عز شانه السيد عبد الله اديب الشهير بجنت زاده القاضي بمدينة ارضروم عفي عنه في سنة اثنى وستين ومائتين والف" ; also on 'title page' (p.1), octagonal seal impression, fairly illegible ; octagonal seal impression on p.19 reads "رب سهل امور السيد اسماعيل ۱۲۲۲" ; octagonal seal impression on p.38-39 (difficult to make out) ; oval seal impression on p.45 reads "سيد اسمعيل ۱۲۲۲" surrounded by a decorative inscription ; on p.124 ownership statement reads "صاحب ومالك منلا على افندى" ; glosses and marginal corrections.
